message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.CR

The paper discusses the joint modeling and optimization of search and recommendation, which are both related to information retrieval (IR) and machine learning (ML). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also mentions the recent advances in neural network technologies, which are commonly used in machine learning and deep learning research, suggesting that the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper proposes a general framework for jointly learning retrieval and recommendation models, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and optimization techniques, indicating that it may also fit into cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.CY (Computers and Society). Finally, the paper discusses the potential benefits of joint modeling for search and recommendation, which may involve security and privacy concerns, suggesting that it may also belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
